sentences.english: This volume contains selections from his early works.
sentences.chinese: 该卷包含了他的早期作品文选。

sentences.english: There are special reasons why Qi Liang Fu was not included in Wenxuan.
sentences.chinese: 但《文选》不录齐梁赋，却有其特殊原因。

sentences.english: John's composition are always heavy- footed.
sentences.chinese: 约翰的作文选词总是不当。

sentences.english: There are various problems in Selections, but it was not compiled in haste.
sentences.chinese: 《文选》存在着种种问题，然非仓促成书。

sentences.english: Scanlon, Jennifer, ed. The Gender and Consumer Culture Reader. 2000.
The bad criticism to The Selection of Literary Works by Sushi, affected his spread.
sentences.chinese: 苏轼对《文选》恶评颇多，影响了《文选》的流布。

sentences.english: The bad criticism to The Selection of Literary Works by Sushi, affected his spread.
sentences.chinese: 苏轼对《文选》恶评颇多，影响了《文选》的流布。

sentences.english: Sorry, I don't have this book. Can you provide the proof?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有沈文选的《平几证明全书习题解答》？

sentences.english: Thus, Dissolved Gases in oil is used as character of the fault diagnosis.
sentences.chinese: 因此，本文选用油中溶解气体作为故障诊断的特征量。

sentences.english: Wenxuan selected by Xiao Tong is the earliest existing set of poems.
sentences.chinese: 萧统《文选》是我国现存最早的一部诗文总集。

sentences.english: Today's lesson is taken from the St Mark's Gospel.
sentences.chinese: 今日的经文选自《马可福音》。

sentences.english: I made the book crinkle and black with a mess.
sentences.chinese: 我把那本作文选揉皱了，揩黑了。

sentences.english: LI-xiang was the famous scholar of WenXuan in modern times.
sentences.chinese: 李详是我国近代著名的《文选》学家。

sentences.english: In the period of Song Dynasties, Literary Selections was spread in the South more flourishingly than in the North.
sentences.chinese: 两宋时《文选》的流布区域呈现南方盛于北方的局面。

sentences.english: The first chapter is the survey of "epistolary".
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要是《文选》“书信体”概说。

sentences.english: Wenxuan had exerted a profound influence on later ages literature development.
sentences.chinese: 《文选》对后世文学的发展具有深远的影响。

definition: Finest Blossoms in the Garden of Literature, Song dynasty collection of poetry, odes, songs and writings compiled during 982-986 under Li Fang 李昉[Li3 Fang3], Xu Xuan 徐鉉|徐铉[Xu2 Xuan4], Song Bai 宋白[Song4 Bai2] and Su Yijian 蘇易簡|苏易简[Su1 Yi4 jian3], 1000 scrolls
Siku Quanshu (collection of books compiled during Qing dynasty)
Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty

A Mirror for the Wise Ruler (or Comprehensive Mirror for Aid in Government), a vast chronological general history, written by 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] Sima Guang (1019-1089) and collaborators during the Northern Song in 1084, covering the period 403 BC-959 AD, 294 scrolls
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts

History of Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4] or Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], sixth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Shen Yue 沈約|沈约[Shen2 Yue4] in 488 during Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁[Nan2 chao2 Liang2], 100 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋史[Song4 shi3])

Three Commentaries on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], including Mr Gongyang's annals 公羊傳|公羊传[Gong1 yang2 Zhuan4], Mr Guliang's annals 穀梁傳|谷梁传[Gu3 liang2 Zhuan4] and Mr Zuo's annals or Zuo Zhuan 左傳|左传[Zuo3 Zhuan4]

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
